trans-unit.source: Represents a data item in a data-bound list control.
This class cannot be inherited.

A ListItem control represents an individual data item within a data-bound list control, such as a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> or a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control.
There are several ways to specify the text displayed for an item in the list control.
The most common method is by placing text in the inner HTML content.
The inner HTML content is the text between the opening and closing tags of the ListItem control.
You can also use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Text%2A> property to specify the text displayed in the list control for the item.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Value%2A> property allows you to associate a value with the item in the list control, in addition to the text displayed in the control.

For example, you can display text for an item in the list control, such as `"Item 1"`, and use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Value%2A> property to specify a value for that item, such as `"$1.99"`.
You can have any combination of the inner HTML content, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Text%2A>, or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Value%2A> properties set.
The resulting HTML output for the ListItem control depends on the combination of these three properties that are set.

For example, if all three properties are set as follows: ``` <asp:ListItem Value="Value 1" Text="Item 1">Inner 1</asp:ListItem> ``` The inner HTML content is used for rendered inner HTML content and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Value%2A> property is used for the `Value` attribute.

The resulting HTML rendering output is: ``` <option value="Value 1">Inner 1</option> ``` The following table lists the combination of set properties and the corresponding property used for the rendered inner HTML content and `Value` attribute.
The three columns on the left list the combination of set properties.
The two columns on the right list which property value is used for the corresponding attribute.

|Inner HTML content|Text property|Value property|Rendered Inner HTML content|Rendered Value attribute| |------------------------|-------------------|--------------------|---------------------------------|------------------------------| |Set|Set|Set|Inner HTML content|Value property| |Set|Set|Not set|Inner HTML content|Inner HTML content| |Set|Not set|Set|Inner HTML content|Value property| |Set|Not set|Not set|Inner HTML content|Inner HTML text| |Not set|Set|Set|Text property|Value property| |Not set|Set|Not set|Text property|Text property| |Not set|Not set|Set|Value property|Value property| |Not set|Not set|Not set|Not set|Not set| > [!NOTE] > Because the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Text%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Value%2A> properties each have a default value of an empty string, it is possible to have empty list items in the list control.
When a list control is displayed, any ListItem control with its <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Selected%2A> property set to `true` appears highlighted in the control.
The ListItem control provides the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Enabled%2A> property to allow you to specify whether a ListItem control is enabled or disabled.
A ListItem control that is disabled is dimmed to indicate that it cannot be selected.
Use this property to disable a ListItem control in either a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control or a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> control.
> [!NOTE] > You cannot use this property to disable a ListItem control in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DropDownList> control or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> control.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of ListItem, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
> [!CAUTION] > This control can be used to display user input, which might include malicious client script.
Check any information that is sent from a client for executable script, SQL statements, or other code before displaying it in your application.
You can use validation controls to verify user input before displaying the input text in a control.
ASP.NET provides an input request validation feature to block script and HTML in user input.

For more information, see [Securing Standard Controls](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md), [How to: Protect Against Script Exploits in a Web Application by Applying HTML Encoding to Strings](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md), and [Validating User Input in ASP.NET Web Pages](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> class using default values.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem>.
|Property|Initial Value| |--------------|-------------------| |`Text`|`null`| |`Value`|`null`| |`Enabled`|`true`|
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> class with the specified text data.
Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> class using the specified text.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem>.
|Property|Initial Value| |--------------|-------------------| |`Text`|The value of the `text` parameter.| |`Value`|`null`| |`Enabled`|`true`|
The text to display in the list control for the item represented by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> class with the specified text and value data.
Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> class using the specified text and value.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem>.
|Property|Initial Value| |--------------|-------------------| |`Text`|The value of the `text` parameter.| |`Value`|The value of the `value` parameter.| |`Enabled`|`true`|
The text to display in the list control for the item represented by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref>.
The value associated with the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> class with the specified text, value, and enabled data.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem>.

|Property|Initial Value| |--------------|-------------------| |`Text`|The value of the `text` parameter.| |`Value`|The value of the `value` parameter.| |`Enabled`|The value of the `enabled` parameter.|
The text to display in the list control for the item represented by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref>.
The value associated with the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref>.
Indicates whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> is enabled.
Gets a collection of attribute name and value pairs for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> that are not directly supported by the class.

Use the Attributes collection to manage the attribute name and value pairs declared in the opening and closing tags of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem>, but not directly supported by the class.
You can programmatically add or remove attributes to the collection.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.AttributeCollection"></xref> that contains a collection of name and value pairs.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the list item is enabled.
The Enabled property allows you to specify whether a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> control is enabled or disabled.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> control that is disabled is dimmed to indicate that it cannot be selected.

Use this property to disable a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> control in either a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control or a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> control.

> [!NOTE] > You cannot use this property to disable a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> control in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DropDownList> control or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> control.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the list item is enabled; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Determines whether the specified object has the same value and text as the current list item.
The object to compare with the current list item.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the specified object is equivalent to the current list item; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Creates a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> from the specified text.
Use the FromString static method to create a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> from the specified text.
This method sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Text%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> to the text specified by the `s` parameter.
The text to display in the list control for the item represented by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref>.
A that represents the text specified by the s parameter.
Serves as a hash function for a particular type, and is suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures like a hash table.
Serves as a hash function for a particular type, and is suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures like a hash table.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the item is selected.
Use the Selected property to determine whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> is currently selected in the list control that contains it.
This property is commonly used, when iterating through a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> objects in a list control, to determine whether an item is selected.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the item is selected; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns the attribute value of the list item control having the specified attribute name.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IAttributeAccessor> interface.
The name component of an attribute's name/value pair.
The value of the specified attribute.
Sets an attribute of the list item control with the specified name and value.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IAttributeAccessor> interface.
The name component of the attribute's name/value pair.
The value component of the attribute's name/value pair.
Allows the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Text*> property to be persisted as inner content.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IParserAccessor> interface.
The specified object that is parsed.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager.IsTrackingViewState%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if view state is being tracked; otherwise <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager.LoadViewState%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.
An <xref:System.Object> that contains the saved view state values for the control.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager.SaveViewState%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.
The <xref:System.Object> that contains the view state changes.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager.TrackViewState%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> interface.
Gets or sets the text displayed in a list control for the item represented by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref>.
Use the Text property to specify or determine the text displayed in a list control for the item represented by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem>.
> [!NOTE] > If the Text property contains `null`, the `get` accessor returns the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Value%2A> property.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Value%2A> property, in turn, contains `null`, <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=fullName> is returned.
The value of this property, when set, can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The text displayed in a list control for the item represented by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref> control.
The default value is <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=fullName>.
Returns a string that represents the current object.
A string that represents the current object.
Gets or sets the value associated with the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref>.
Use the Value property to specify or determine the value associated with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem>.
> [!NOTE] > If the Value property contains `null`, the `get` accessor returns the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Text%2A> property.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Text%2A> property, in turn, contains `null`, <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=fullName> is returned.
The value of this property, when set, can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The value associated with the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem"></xref>.
The default is <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=fullName>.
